main event: On 17 August 1958, witnesses observed a round bluish-white object larger than a star, moving ENE at 35 knots for 3 minutes before turning NNW.
interesting points: The object was described as larger than a star and bluish-white in color., The sighting lasted for 3 minutes and the object was observed blowing., The object moved at a speed of 35 knots., There were two witnesses, both ex-Air Force officers., The report suggested that the object might have been a satellite, but there was no confirmation.
